H0.text: Comparing how the soils are alike is the action a student should most likely take to determine which type of soil holds the most water.

H1.text: Putting the soils into different groups is the action the student should most likely do to determine which type of soil holds the most water.

H2.text: Recording the weight of the soil is the action the student should most likely do to determine which type of soil holds the most water.

H3.text: Watching how quickly the soil drains is the action a student should most likely do to determine which type of soil holds the most water.

A4.text: Fine textured soils generally have a higher capacity for water retention, whereas sandy soils contain large pore spaces that allow leaching.

A5.text: Particle size and distribution will affect a soil's capacity for holding water and nutrients.
